hackathon-description-text: This is the premiere spring-time Hackathon in the Montery Bay! Come to the coastal CSUMB campus for several days of hacking, socializing, and fun - food and workspace provided at no cost! This is an official
hackathon-requirements: No projects may be submitted that contain functionality that was not designed and coded during the hackathon. Libraries, modules, etc are fine - but the larger scope and functionality of the project must be original and created during the event.
hackathon-rules:
See the 
 page for rules and regulations.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3052 Divarty St, Seaside, CA 93955, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: 20 points of the 80 points possible is assigned based on technical complexity of the project.

The judging will be done in a demonstration style - each group needs to be ready to present their projects for judging. The functionality and quality of the demonstration will be taken into account and is worth 20 points out of 80 total points available.
The originality of the project will be responsible for 20 points out of 80 total available.
The usefulness of the project will be taken into account and is worth 20 points out of 80 total points available.

No exceptions. All submissions must be on time, and we suggest submitting by 11am at the latest. No exceptions. All projects must be submitted by the deadline. No exceptions. Submit early, submit often. No exceptions.

hackathon-description-header: Celebrate Earth Day with a multi-day Hackathon at the CSUMB campus!
hackathon-location-description: CSUMB - Business and Information Technology Center
